results.title: Sunday drives
results.creator_credit: Fiona Tinney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fiona Tinney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.
description_for_label: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.

results.title: Not for publication
results.creator_credit: Juli Stopp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Juli Stopp tells the story that she has waited her whole life to tell, of the time she nearly died and the tools that she arms herself with to not only survive but be happy.

results.title: The Full bell curve
results.creator_credit: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paula Pippin and her husband told their friends they were moving to the country, the responses ranged from suspicion to outright hostility. But the Pippin family were on an adventure which would introduce them to the full bell curve of society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: True friend
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Phan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Moving to a new city and making new friends is never easy, and Elizabeth Phan found it particularly difficult. Gradually, though, Phan was able to learn the meaning of the words ‘true friend’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth Phan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Linh Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Rangipukea
results.creator_credit: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vanessa James talks about the island just off the end of the farm that her family used to own. There they would farm sheep and cattle over the years and throughout the generations.

results.title: Boy from the block
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Robertson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jeffery Robertson grew up in a tough neighbourhood where survival was a daily imperative. Later on in life, this survival instinct would kick in to fight discrimination in the community and to feed his will to live.
